intro: Mariscus procerus, commonly known as the slender mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Mariscus procerus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
